intro: Dorstenia mandioccana, commonly known as the Mandiocca or the "garden spider plant," is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its long, trailing stems and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. Dorstenia mandioccana is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
